properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Wildfire Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: The Mandatory Evacuation Order is lifted however, an Evacuation Alert remains in place for the Peerless and Trout Lake communities due to wildfires still being in the area. People must be prepared to evacuation on short notice if the situation changes. ### Peerless Trout First Nation website is www.ptfn.net andwww.facebook.com/peerlesstroutfirstnation/ is the Facebook page for this community. Additional Wildfire information is also available at www.wildfire.alberta.ca website. Check https://511.alberta.ca/#:Alerts for more information on road conditions.
Expires: 2019-06-15T10:40:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Peerless Trout First Nation, 2019-06-08T10:39:39-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-5824
Area: Peerless Lake First Nation
properties.Author: Alberta Emergency Management Agency on behalf of Peerless Trout First Nation

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:23 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-09T02:13:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-09T00:23:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1274635130.2019
Area: M.D. of Bighorn near Ghost River Wilderness, Mountain View Co. near Sundre, Mountain View Co. near Cremona and Water Valley
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first heat event of the season is continuing today as a warm air mass moves over parts of Northern Ontario from the United States. Maximum daytime temperatures are expected to be near 30 degrees Celsius today and minimum temperature near 18 degrees Celsius tonight. Cooler air is expected to arrive Sunday afternoon after the passage of a slow moving cold front. Ogoki Post may reach 30 degrees Celsius again on Sunday if the cold front reaches the community late in the day. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-09T04:16:29-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-08T20:17:29-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1653107763.2019
Area: Pickle Lake - Cat Lake, Fort Hope - Lansdowne House - Ogoki
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High southerly winds will blow up to 100 kilometres per hour starting Sunday evening into Monday morning. ### Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable this evening for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. These storms could produce hail up to 4 cm diameter and wind gusts up to 100 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2019-06-09T08:24:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-09T00:10:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2221005444.2019
Area: Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell, Pickle Lake - Cat Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: High levels of air pollution and deteriorated air quality are expected to continue due to smoke from forest fires very close to Pickle Lake. If you, or someone in your care, develop symptoms, reduce or reschedule strenuous outdoors activities where ever possible until the air quality improves. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-09T12:35:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Province of Ontario, 2019-06-08T20:36:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1579409081.2019
Area: Pickle Lake - Cat Lake

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. An area of thunderstorms will be moving over the region over the next several hours. Areas that see more than one thunderstorm could receive 50 mm of rain or more. These storms should weaken and move out of the region tonight. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Heavy rainfall in combination with other weather factors, such as hail, wind and lightning will make outdoor activities unsafe. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-09T15:48:35-00:00

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:

A few thunderstorms over the area are tracking northeastward and they are expected to continue this evening. ### Large hail can damage vessels and cause injury. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke is causing poor air quality and reducing visibility. Smoke is expected or occurring. Air quality in northern Alberta will continue to remain poor near and to the southeast of wildfires. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. People with lung diseases, such as asthma and COPD, can be particularly sensitive to air pollution. They will generally experience more serious health effects at lower levels. Pollution can aggravate their diseases, leading to increased medication use, doctor and emergency room visits, and hospital visits. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-09T13:29:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, Alberta Environment and Parks, Alberta Health, Alberta Health Services, 2019-06-08T21:30:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1633709078.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:48 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, nickel to ping pong ball size hail and heavy rain. Scattered thunderstorms are expected to continue this evening. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2019-06-09T02:34:20-00:00

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Cool temperatures, light winds and clear skies will bring frosty conditions to some parts of the region tonight. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-09T10:40:30-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:22 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This storm is approximately 25 km northwest of Okotoks and is moving southeastward at 20 km/h. ### Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
